meta.title: Arturo's 1st Birthday: The Treasure Hunt
meta.subtitle: A pirate adventure divided into phases to celebrate Arturo's first year

phases.name: Gathering at the Port
phases.description: Arrival and preparations to get guests into character

activities.title: The Time Machine
activities.stationIntro: Welcome, adventurers! Before we set sail, let's send a magical message to the future. Little Arturo will see it when he grows up!
activities.objective: Capture messages of wisdom for Arturo's future
activities.description: Each family upon arrival records a brief piece of advice (maximum 5 seconds) for Arturo in the future. A time capsule full of love and wisdom.
materials: Mobile phone or camera for recording
instructions: Set up the recording station at the entrance
Greet each family as they arrive
Explain: 'We're going to send a message to the future for Arturo'
Indicate they have maximum 5 seconds to give advice
Record each family's message
Thank them and direct them to the balloon area
promptSuggestions: What advice would you give Arturo for his future?
What do you wish for Arturo when he grows up?
tips: Have examples ready for families who don't know what to say
Keep the pace quick, no more than 1 minute per family
Save all videos to create a special montage later
One dedicated adult at this station during all arrivals

activities.title: The Balloon Arsenal
activities.stationIntro: Every pirate needs their sword! The ship's armorer will prepare your weapon for the adventure.
activities.objective: Transform kids into pirates while they wait
activities.description: Balloon twisting station where swords or pirate hats are made as children arrive.
materials: Long balloons bag (260Q for balloon twisting)
instructions: Set up the station before guests arrive
Inflate and quickly model balloon swords
Kids can practice sword duels (carefully) while waiting
Optionally make pirate hats for variety
tips: Have several pre-made swords for early arrivals
One dedicated adult at this station during arrival

activities.title: The Call to Adventure
activities.objective: Explain the mission and excite them for the adventure
activities.description: Reading of the welcome letter explaining that the treasure is not gold, but friendship.
materials: Letter from the Pirate King (printed or on parchment)

script.intro: Read when most guests have gathered
script.text:
Ahoy, young pirates!

My name is Gol D. Roger, the King of Pirates. I left behind the greatest treasure of all: the One Piece. It is not gold or jewels, but the symbol of adventure, dreams, and friendship.

I have heard legends about the fearless Captain AMG. I have left you a map that will guide you through twelve legendary trials. Only when you prove you are a true pirate family will the path to the One Piece be revealed.

Raise the Jolly Roger and sharpen your wits! May the winds be in your favor!

instructions: Wait until most guests have arrived
Gather everyone in a circle
Read with a dramatic and exciting voice
Explain they must overcome the trials like true pirates

activities.title: Boarding Rules
activities.objective: Explain game dynamics and divide teams
activities.description: Brief explanation of how the adventure will work.
materials: Stamps or stickers to mark completed trials

rules.title: Two Crews
rules.description: We'll split into two groups to navigate better

rules.title: Companionship
rules.description: It's not a race against the other team. We all win if we reach the end!

rules.title: Rotation
rules.description: Some will go to certain islands while others go elsewhere to avoid waiting

rules.title: The Map
rules.description: Each time you complete a trial, put a stamp on your map!

instructions: Divide children into 2 balanced crews by age
Assign an adult captain to each crew
Give map to each group
Explain rotation system between stations

phases.name: The Grand Line Trials
phases.description: Main circuit of activities and games

activities.title: The Great Leap to Skypiea
activities.stationIntro: I'm Luffy, and I'm gonna be King of the Pirates! My body is made of rubber and I can stretch reaaally far. Let's fly up to the clouds!
activities.objective: Work together to launch the balloon as high as possible
activities.description: Use a giant blanket as a parachute to launch a balloon and touch a 'giant's' hand.

steps.name: Rubber Skin
steps.instruction: All pirates grab the edges of the giant blanket and place a balloon in the center

steps.name: The Giant
steps.instruction: An adult stands nearby with raised arm (acting as a giant or sky island)

steps.name: Gomu Gomu no ROCKET!
steps.instruction: On the count of three, children must pull the blanket tight to launch the balloon as high as possible and try to touch the adult's hand

activities.title: The Swordsman's Path
activities.stationIntro: I'm Zoro, the world's greatest swordsman... but I always get lost! Let's spin around and see if you can walk straight better than me. Use the swords you got when you arrived!
activities.objective: Maintain balance after getting dizzy and knock down targets
activities.description: Spin 3 times to get dizzy and walk straight to knock down bottles with the balloon sword.
materials: Balloon swords from the beginning (shared among the crew)

steps.name: Prepare the Swords
steps.instruction: Remind them: 'We use the balloon swords we got when we arrived! If you don't have one, a crewmate will lend you theirs. We're a crew and we share!'

steps.name: I'm Lost!
steps.instruction: The pirate spins 3 quick times to get slightly dizzy (Zoro style)

steps.name: Santoryu!
steps.instruction: Immediately after, must walk straight toward the enemy bottles

steps.name: The Cut
steps.instruction: Using the balloon sword, must knock down as many bottles as possible in one swing. Then pass the sword to the next pirate!

tips: Not everyone needs a sword at once - they take turns and share
If a sword pops, remind them there are more or they can share
Celebrate every attempt, not just successful ones

activities.title: The Sniper's Rings
activities.stationIntro: I am the great Captain Usopp, the bravest sniper on the seas! Well... sometimes I get a little scared. But my aim is perfect! Can you land as many rings as me?
activities.objective: Land as many rings as possible together
activities.description: Throw rings at the sticks trying to land as many as possible. All together as a crew!
materials: Sticks or stakes stuck in the ground (5-6)

steps.name: Set Up the Field
steps.instruction: Stick the poles in the ground at different distances. Mark a throwing line.

steps.name: Hand Out the Rings
steps.instruction: Each pirate receives 2-3 rings to throw. Remind them: 'It's not a competition! We're a crew and we want to land ALL the rings together.'

steps.name: Let's Throw!
steps.instruction: Taking turns, each pirate throws their rings trying to land them on the sticks. Others cheer: 'You can do it!'

steps.name: Count Together
steps.instruction: At the end, count ALL the rings landed by the whole crew. Celebrate the group result: 'Together we got X rings!'

tips: Adjust the distance based on children's age
If a child doesn't land any, encourage them and let them try closer
Always emphasize that the result belongs to EVERYONE, not individual

activities.title: The Fire Kick
activities.stationIntro: I'm Sanji, the ship's cook. My hands are only for cooking, but my kicks are so strong they catch fire! Can you knock down the cups with just one kick?
activities.objective: Knock down plastic cups using only legs
activities.description: Use your legs to knock down a tower of plastic cups. Like Sanji's fire kicks!
materials: Low table or surface to stack the cups

steps.name: The Ingredient Tower
steps.instruction: Stack the plastic cups forming a pyramid or tower on a low table or the ground

steps.name: Combat Position
steps.instruction: The pirate stands in front of the tower. Remind them: 'Sanji only uses his legs! Hands are for cooking, not fighting.'

steps.name: Diable Jambe!
steps.instruction: With one kick, the pirate tries to knock down as many cups as possible. Shout 'Diable Jambe!' when kicking!

steps.name: Rebuild Together
steps.instruction: Everyone helps stack the cups again for the next pirate. The crew helps each other!

tips: Adjust the tower height based on child's age
If a child has difficulty, move the tower closer
Everyone helps pick up and stack - teamwork

activities.title: Emergency Repairs
activities.stationIntro: SUPER! I'm Franky, I'm half robot and I built the coolest ship in the world. But it has holes! Help me fix it before it sinks!
activities.location: Outdoor Area (where floor can get wet)
activities.objective: Repair the ship before it sinks
activities.description: Run to patch holes in a bucket with stickers before it fills with water.

steps.name: Battle Damage
steps.instruction: Show the bucket full of holes

steps.name: Repair Line
steps.instruction: Pirates form a line. One by one, they take a sticker (adults help younger ones peel it), run to the bucket and cover a hole

steps.name: Quality Check
steps.instruction: When all holes have stickers, the Captain pours water inside. If there are no leaks, the ship is ready to sail!

activities.title: The Storm Tale
activities.stationIntro: I'm Nami, the navigator! I can predict the weather just by smelling it. A terrible storm is coming! Are you ready to survive?
activities.description: Children react to keywords (Wave, Lightning, Cyclone) with physical movements.

training.intro: The Captain teaches the key moves:

script.intro: The Adventure: The Captain reads the story and children act when they hear the capitalized words
script.text: The Thousand Sunny was sailing peacefully through the sea... when suddenly Nami smelled the air and shouted: 'Watch out, a GIANT WAVE!'. The ship jumped very high and suddenly a LIGHTNING bolt struck from the sky. We kept sailing but another GIANT WAVE appeared. Luffy grabbed onto the mast when a CYCLONE made us spin non-stop. The wind calmed for a moment... but then another LIGHTNING!. Zoro drew his swords when he saw a GIANT WAVE coming. The ship went up and down, up and down. Chopper screamed scared because a new CYCLONE trapped us spinning round and round. Sanji almost lost his cigarette with so much LIGHTNING falling from the sky. Usopp hid when another GIANT WAVE passed. Finally Nami saw the island in the distance! But first we had to pass one last CYCLONE... We made it! Captain Luffy shouted with all his might: DROP ANCHOR! And finally... we were saved!

activities.title: The Secret Garden
activities.stationIntro: I'm Chopper, the ship's doctor! I was a reindeer but I ate a magic fruit and now I can talk. I need your help to find secret medicines.
activities.description: Guess hidden objects in a box using only touch.
materials: Objects with different textures: pinecone, cotton, rocks, sandpaper, sponge, feather

steps.name: Hidden Ingredients
steps.instruction: The objects are hidden inside the box

steps.name: The Diagnosis
steps.instruction: Without looking, the pirate puts their hand through the hole

steps.name: Guessing
steps.instruction: Only by touching, must shout what the object is (ex: 'It's a cotton cloud!', 'It's a rough rock!')

activities.title: The Crew's Treasure
activities.stationIntro: I'm Robin, the archaeologist. I've discovered that there are 4 treasure chests hidden around here. But remember, pirates... a true crew always shares the loot!
activities.objective: Find the chests and learn to share like true pirates
activities.description: Search for 4 hidden treasure chests, bring them to the center, and decide together how to split the loot fairly.
materials: Treasure to share (candy, gummies, small toys)
Table or central area to gather the chests

steps.name: The Mission
steps.instruction: Explain: 'There are 4 treasure chests hidden. You have to find them all and bring them to the center! But careful... don't open them yet!'

steps.name: The Search
steps.instruction: The children spread out to find the 4 chests. When they find one, they bring it to the center, and must shout: 'I'm a pirate who found a treasure!' and keep searching until all 4 are found.

steps.name: The Gathering
steps.instruction: When all 4 chests are there, gather everyone in a circle. Ask: 'Who found each chest?' Celebrate everyone who searched.

steps.name: The Pirate Lesson
steps.instruction: Explain: 'In a real pirate crew, the treasure is NOT just for the one who finds it. It belongs to the WHOLE crew! Why? Because EVERYONE worked together to get it.'

steps.name: The Fair Split
steps.instruction: Open the chests and show the treasure. Ask the children: 'How do we split it so it's fair for everyone?' Guide them until they decide to share equally.

steps.name: The Pirate Code
steps.instruction: Everyone repeats: 'We are a crew! We share the treasure!' Then distribute the loot equally among everyone.

tips: Prepare the treasure so it can be easily divided among all children
If a child wants to keep more, gently remind them that pirates share
Celebrate when they decide to share fairly

activities.title: The Binks' Sake Orchestra
activities.stationIntro: YOHOHO! I'm Brook, a skeleton musician. I died but came back to life thanks to a magic fruit! Want to play music with me? I'm so excited I get goosebumps... even though I have no skin! YOHOHO!
activities.description: Rhythm imitation game (claps, feet) guided by an adult.

levels.name: Grand Finale
levels.pattern: Foot - Foot - Clap - Toast (raise hand) - 'HAPPY BIRTHDAY ARTURO!'

steps.name: The Conductor
steps.instruction: The adult ('Soul King') makes a rhythm with body and voice

steps.name: The Echo
steps.instruction: Pirates must repeat it exactly. If they fail, the captain laughs with a 'Yohoho'!

activities.title: The Treasure Race
activities.stationIntro: I'm Jimbei, a fish-man. I can swim faster than anyone and control water. Let's see who can transport the most water without spilling!
activities.objective: Transport as much water as possible
activities.description: Transport water from one bucket to another using giant sponges.

steps.name: Load
steps.instruction: Soak the giant sponge in the full bucket

steps.name: Run
steps.instruction: Carry the dripping sponge to the empty bucket without losing too much water

steps.name: Squeeze
steps.instruction: Fill the target bucket to the mark as fast as possible

activities.title: Captain Arturo's Grand Finale
activities.stationIntro: You've passed all the trials! Now you must summon Captain Arturo to reveal the treasure. Only true pirates can do it!
activities.objective: Summon the Captain and reveal the treasure
activities.description: Form the initials A-M-G with shoes on the floor to summon the cake.

steps.name: The Final Riddle
steps.instruction: For the treasure (and cake) to appear, the crew must summon the Captain

steps.name: Giant Initials
steps.instruction: Everyone takes off their shoes and uses them to form the letters A - M - G (Arturo) on the ground

steps.name: The Legendary Photo
steps.instruction: Captain Arturo stands in the middle of the letters and the 'Crew Photo' is taken from above

steps.name: Party Time!
steps.instruction: Once the photo is taken, the cake appears and the treasure is distributed!

activities.title: Opening the Chest
activities.stationIntro: We did it, crew! We found the One Piece. The real treasure was the adventure and friends we made along the way. But there are also prizes!
activities.description: Opens after singing happy birthday. Contains individual bags to avoid conflicts.
instructions: Sing happy birthday
Blow out candles
Open the treasure chest
Distribute individual bags (one per child)
Give out 'Wanted' diplomas
tips: Prepare identical bags to avoid conflicts
Have extra bags just in case

rotationTips: Alternate teams at stations to avoid waiting
Cooperative activities (1, 6, 9, 11) can be done together
Individual activities (2, 3, 4, 7) work better in small groups

needed: 6 Poneglyph cards (Parrot, Island, Rudder, Anchor, Treasure, Eye patch)
